The patient presents with increasing heartburn, weight loss, and anemia, which suggests a possible diagnosis of esophageal or gastric cancer. The most appropriate next step in the management is to perform an esophagogastroduodenoscopy to investigate the cause of the symptoms and provide a diagnosis. 24-hour esophageal pH monitoring and esophageal manometry may be used to diagnose gastroesophageal reflux disease but are not the most appropriate next step in this patient with concerning symptoms. A trial of proton-pump inhibitor may be initiated if esophagogastroduodenoscopy does not reveal any malignancy.
